error.signature: error[E0507]: cannot move out of borrowed content

verdict.summary: Attempting to move a value out of a borrowed reference, which would leave the reference dangling.

dead_ends.action: Using unsafe to force the move
dead_ends.why_fails: Creates a dangling reference; undefined behavior

dead_ends.action: Using mem::replace with Default to swap out
dead_ends.why_fails: Only works if the type implements Default; may leave invalid state

workarounds.action: Clone the value: let owned = borrowed_ref.field.clone()
workarounds.how: Creates an independent copy that can be moved freely

workarounds.action: Take ownership by consuming the struct: fn consume(self) -> Field
workarounds.how: Change from &self to self to take ownership and decompose

frequently_confused_with.distinction: '[E0507]' indicates moving out of borrowed content, while '[E0425]' indicates a value not found in scope.
